intro: Podanthum trichocalycinum, commonly known as the velvet leaf. This plant is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its velvety, hairy foliage. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a soft, textured surface. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and unique leaf texture.
